name: Dwarf
description: Carved of the stone itself, dwarves maintain a deep connection to the earth. They are masters of mining and metalworking, renowned for their craftsmanship and skill. They value honor and tradition, and their unyielding determination reflects their unbreakable bond with the earth. In Atakhet, dwarven stoneworkers are highly prized for their ability to craft monuments that withstand the harsh desert conditions.

known_cultures.name: Mahruk
known_cultures.description: TODO (merchant dwarves from the northern islands)

known_cultures.name: Ghahar
known_cultures.description: Master architects who construct impregnable strongholds, often serving as royal engineers in Atakhet

known_cultures.name: Urduk
known_cultures.description: TODO (evil djinn-serving dwarves from the ashen badlands)

far_away_cultures.name: Dhurvar
far_away_cultures.description: Stoic mountain dwellers who carve their homes from snow-covered mountainsides

abilities.name: Dwarven Sight
abilities.description: You can roughly make out differences in temperature by sight, granting you vision even in total darkness. You can see at melee range in absolute darkness as in bright light and up to a medium distance as in dim light.

abilities.name: Stoneskin
abilities.description: You gain +1 AV. When you have to roll with Fortitude to withstand poison, intoxication, or illness, you gain +1 boon on the roll.

abilities.name: Squat Build
abilities.description: You impose +1 bane on rolls that attempt to knock you prone or push you. Also when you are pushed, reduce the distance by one step (if you are pushed close, instead you aren't pushed at all).

name: Elf
description: Living in a spiritual symbiotic state with the life force of nature in their immediate environment, elves are intimately connected to the natural world. They are sensitive to changes in their surroundings and suffer physically when in barren or lifeless terrain for too long. They are often aloof and unapproachable, but their fierce loyalty to their home and way of life is unwavering. In the realm of Atakhet, the Ra'thep sun-elves have adapted to channel the desert's harsh energies, ruling as divine representatives blessed by the sun.

known_cultures.name: Anutep
known_cultures.description: Dark-skinned desert dwellers who rule Atakhet as divine representatives, drawing power from the sun

far_away_cultures.name: Sylvar
far_away_cultures.description: Secretive woodland protectors who rarely venture beyond their forest borders

far_away_cultures.name: Alfir
far_away_cultures.description: Nocturnal elves who dwell in twilight realms and ancient tombs

far_away_cultures.name: Ho'shien
far_away_cultures.description: Nomadic traders who follow the great rivers, serving as vital links between isolated communities

abilities.name: Night Vision
abilities.description: You can see one range category further from sources of bright and dim light.

abilities.name: Fleet-Footed
abilities.description: You can choose to gain +1 Movement during your turn. You can use this ability once per combat.

abilities.name: Spiritual Symbiosis
abilities.description: You take nourishment from the natural world around you. While in the wilderness with lush vegetation, you only need to sleep for 4 hours each night, allowing you to use the remaining 4 hours for light non-physical activity.

name: Gnome
description: Natural psychics with the ability to read other people's intentions and surface thoughts, the child-sized gnomes are an open and harmonious culture. However, this often makes them naive when faced with other folk who attempt to deceive them. Their playful nature is a welcome addition to any company. In Atakhet, gnomes often serve as diplomatic intermediaries, using their empathic abilities to foster understanding between different folk.

known_cultures.name: Auflin
known_cultures.description: Gentle river-dwellers who establish communities near oases and waterways

known_cultures.name: Burrin
known_cultures.description: Industrious tunnel-builders who create elaborate underground communities

abilities.name: Natural Empath
abilities.description: You can read the surface thoughts and emotions of any close creature by rolling Spirit + Insight. You can also project your feelings to a creature close to you, allowing you to communicate simple ideas with animals and other creatures. You also intuitively know how many living creatures are close to you and their general direction.

abilities.name: Scent of Illusions
abilities.description: You can instinctively make out illusions and invisible things. You gain +1 boon on Spirit rolls to identify magical falsehoods and illusions and impose +1 bane on rolls to fool you with falsehoods or illusions.

abilities.name: Small Stature
abilities.description: You are of small size. This grants you the following effects:

name: Hune
description: A race of towering beings with incredible strength and endurance. They are often nomadic and reclusive but possess a deep wisdom and knowledge of the world. In the deserts of Atakhet, Hunes are often sought out as caravan guards or builders for grand monuments, their strength and endurance invaluable in the harsh climate.

known_cultures.name: Hataar
known_cultures.description: Solitary herders and guardians of ancient mountain passes

known_cultures.name: Empyros
known_cultures.description: Seafaring traders who connect distant shores through elaborate trade networks

far_away_cultures.name: Jotnir
far_away_cultures.description: Frost-resistant nomads who navigate the frozen north with ease

far_away_cultures.name: Ta'uuri
far_away_cultures.description: Coastal dwellers who build impressive stone harbors and lighthouses

abilities.name: Giant's Blood
abilities.description: +2 HP. You also gain the following effects:

abilities.name: Stoic Mind
abilities.description: +1 Resist. You gain +1 boon on Spirit + Fortitude rolls.

name: Orc
description: Coming from once violent and brutal cultures, the orcs have a reputation for savagery that many have worked hard to overcome. While many have adopted a more civilized life, the Old Folk often reduce them to the evil deeds of their ancestors. Despite this, orcs value strength and honor above all else, and their fierce determination and indomitable will make them formidable allies. In Atakhet, many orcs serve as elite mercenaries or skilled craftspeople, gradually earning respect through their deeds rather than their lineage.

known_cultures.name: Orgon
known_cultures.description: Seafaring warriors and traders who establish coastal settlements

known_cultures.name: Gataka
known_cultures.description: Expert hunters and trackers who navigate dense forests with ease

far_away_cultures.name: Jinkai
far_away_cultures.description: TODO (misty valley, culture of honor, metal-smithing)

abilities.name: Orcish Fury
abilities.description: When you roll a critical success on an attack with a melee weapon, add your weapon damage an additional time to the total damage.

abilities.name: Pride above Death
abilities.description: When you suffer one Injury, you can choose to ignore it. You can use this ability once per day.

name: Goblin
description: A cunning and resourceful race of small build, with a knack for trickery and deception. They are often viewed as untrustworthy and sneaky, but their ingenuity can be a valuable asset. In the deserts of Atakhet, goblins often serve as scouts or messengers, their small size and quick wits allowing them to navigate both the physical and social landscapes with surprising effectiveness.

known_cultures.name: Sniknez
known_cultures.description: Subterranean dwellers who excel at finding hidden passages and resources

known_cultures.name: Goki
known_cultures.description: Agile climbers who establish communities in cliffs and treetops

abilities.name: Night Vision
abilities.description: You can see one range category further from sources of bright and dim light.

abilities.name: Quick Escape
abilities.description: When an enemy misses you with a melee attack, you can choose to move close without provoking Opportunity Attacks. You can use this ability once between turns.

abilities.name: Small Stature
abilities.description: You are of small size. This grants you the following effects:

name: Human
description: The newest folk among all the New Folk, humans possess a natural arcane ability that makes many other folks scared of them. Others try to subjugate them to make use of their natural gifts as a weapon. As a result, humans are often caught between fear and exploitation, struggling to find their place in a world that fears their power. But their incredible adaptability and boundless ambition have allowed them to thrive despite these challenges. In Atakhet, humans often serve as advisors or arcane specialists, their natural magical talents both valued and closely monitored.

known_cultures.name: Khatok
known_cultures.description: Nomadic tribes who navigate the grasslands at the desert's edge, many of them were brought to Atakhep for manual labor

far_away_cultures.name: Vornheimr
far_away_cultures.description: Hardy northerners who rarely venture into the southern deserts

abilities.name: Will of Perseverance
abilities.description: Re-roll the result of one test and take the new result. You can use this ability once per day.

abilities.name: Arcane Awakening
abilities.description: You have a natural talent for the arcane arts. If you have learned Arcana, you gain +2 Focus. You can cast arcane spells without a Spell Catalyst, but suffer +1 bane on the roll.

name: Catfolk
description: A proud and regal race, with a deep connection to the natural world and a reverence for the power of the hunt. They are often viewed as noble and honorable, but their fierce pride can make them difficult to work with. In the realm of Atakhet, lionfolk often serve as desert guides or warriors, their natural hunting instincts and keen senses invaluable in the harsh environment.

known_cultures.name: Jakharii
known_cultures.description: Tribal hunters who form tight-knit prides and control vast territories

known_cultures.name: Saghal
known_cultures.description: Stealthy predators who blend into their surroundings with remarkable ease

abilities.name: Night Vision
abilities.description: You can see one range category further from sources of bright and dim light.

abilities.name: Intimidating Roar
abilities.description: You can use your Action in combat to unleash a powerful lion's roar. Roll Strength + Fortitude vs. Resist against each creature within short range. On a success, they are frightened of you. They can roll Spirit + Fortitude at the start of their turns. On a success, they stop being frightened. You can use this ability once per combat.

abilities.name: Sharp Claws
abilities.description: You can use your claws (2 weapon damage, light, slash) as brawling weapons instead of unarmed attacks.

name: Lizardfolk
description: A cold-blooded and inscrutable species, with a deep connection to the swamps and marshes where they make their homes. They are often viewed as mysterious and dangerous but possess wisdom and cunning born of their harsh environment. In Atakhet, lizardfolk are often found near the life-giving oases and rivers, serving as guardians of these precious water sources.

known_cultures.name: Vaashk
known_cultures.description: Amphibious dwellers who establish communities in wetlands and river deltas

known_cultures.name: Quexa-kul
known_cultures.description: Colorful tribes who move with surprising stealth through dense vegetation

abilities.name: Thick Scales
abilities.description: Your natural scales grant +3 AV (armor bonus). If you have another higher armor bonus, gain +1 AV instead.

abilities.name: Aquatic Nature
abilities.description: You can hold your breath for 4 + 1/2 Strength minutes.

abilities.name: Reptile Jaws
abilities.description: You can use your bite (3 weapon damage, crush) as a brawling weapon instead of unarmed attacks.

name: Minotaur
description: A horned, furry species known for their immense strength and unwavering determination. They are fiercely protective of their clan and territories, often seen as guardians of sacred places. Their physical prowess is matched by their sense of honor, making them formidable allies and respected adversaries. In Atakhet, minotaurs often serve as temple guardians or caravan protectors, their imposing presence deterring all but the most determined threats.

known_cultures.name: Minokos
known_cultures.description: Seafaring traders who navigate treacherous waters with confidence

known_cultures.name: Enkeddu
known_cultures.description: Nomadic herders who follow seasonal migration patterns

far_away_cultures.name: Yettnar
far_away_cultures.description: Solitary mountain dwellers who guard ancient passes and shrines

far_away_cultures.name: Khutu
far_away_cultures.description: Swift runners who serve as messengers across vast plains

abilities.name: Giant's Blood
abilities.description: +2 HP. You also gain the following effects:

abilities.name: Horns
abilities.description: You can use your horns (3 weapon damage, crush) as a brawling weapon instead of unarmed attacks.

abilities.name: Goring Charge
abilities.description: After you spend 1 or more Movement towards a creature and hit them with an attack using your horns, add your weapon damage an additional time to the total damage.

name: Dogfolk
description: Dogfolk are a canine folk with keen senses and an unshakable loyalty to their kin. Their sharp ears and powerful noses make them unparalleled trackers, while their pack instincts drive them to protect their companions at any cost. Though sometimes dismissed by other folk as overly trusting, their dedication and reliability have earned them a respected place in many communities. In Atakhet, dogfolk often serve as caravan scouts, border patrols, and desert trackers, their senses invaluable for navigating the treacherous sands and detecting hidden dangers.

known_cultures.name: Anubar
known_cultures.description: Jackal-featured trackers who patrol the desert borders and serve as scouts for the great cities of Atakhet

known_cultures.name: Warufi
known_cultures.description: Wild-dog-featured nomads who run in tight-knit packs across the grasslands, serving as messengers and herders

far_away_cultures.name: Fenrin
far_away_cultures.description: Wolf-featured hunters who thrive in cold forests and mountainous terrain

abilities.name: Keen Senses
abilities.description: You have an extraordinary sense of smell and hearing. You gain +1 boon on Spirit + Perception rolls. You can detect the presence and general direction of living creatures within close range by scent alone, even if you can't see them.

abilities.name: Pack Loyalty
abilities.description: When an ally within close range is hit by an attack, you can use your Quick Action to move close towards them without provoking Opportunity Attacks. You can use this ability once between turns.

abilities.name: Bite
abilities.description: You can use your bite (2 weapon damage, crush) as a brawling weapon instead of unarmed attacks.

name: Satyr
description: Satyrs are a spirited and free-willed folk with the legs and horns of goats. Known for their love of music, revelry, and the natural world, satyrs are deeply connected to wild places and resist the constraints of civilization. Their innate resistance to magic and supernatural charm makes them remarkably difficult to manipulate, a trait that has served them well in a world full of sorcery. In Atakhet, satyrs are often found in the lush oases and mountain valleys that border the desert, serving as musicians, herbalists, and guides through the wilderness.

known_cultures.name: Aighar
known_cultures.description: Wandering musicians and herbalists who travel between the desert oases, bringing news and entertainment

known_cultures.name: Kitharo
known_cultures.description: Agile climbers who dwell in the rocky highlands, known for their wild dances and fierce independence

far_away_cultures.name: Faundel
far_away_cultures.description: Woodland dwellers who guard ancient groves and sacred springs

abilities.name: Magic Resistance
abilities.description: You gain +1 boon on rolls to resist spells and other magical effects.

abilities.name: Horns
abilities.description: You can use your horns (2 weapon damage, crush) as brawling weapons instead of unarmed attacks.

abilities.name: Woodland Stride
abilities.description: You treat difficult terrain caused by natural vegetation as normal terrain. You also gain +1 boon on Agility + Athletics rolls to climb or traverse natural environments.
